News analysis

Santorum begins to concede 2012 race

Republican presidential hopeful Rick Santorum warned his party of potential repercussions if it were to nominate Mitt Romney over a true conservative like him. (Globe)

Injuries after tornadoes rake Dallas area

More than a dozen injuries ranging from minor to severe have been reported after tornadoes and violent storms raked through the Dallas area. (AP)
A tornado touched down south of Dallas. At least two tornadoes tore through the Dallas area this afternoon. Parrish Velaso/The Dallas Morning News/AP
Vehicles were damanged at a truck stop parking lot in Lancaster, Texas. Several reported tornadoes tore through the Dallas area on Tuesday. KDFW-TV/AP
Jerica Jenkins looked at the damage to her home. The National Weather Service confirmed at least two separate tornadoes around Dallas. Nomaan Merchant/AP
David Lowe carried his daughter's dog, Phoebe, after the dog was rescued from the rubble of a destroyed home in Arlington, Texas. Tom Pennington/Getty Images
A trailer was overturned on Interstate 20 in southern Dallas after tornadoes tore through the area, leaving flattened tractor trailers strewn along highways. Gerry McCarthy/AP
Harold Widner cleared a tree from his truck in Arlington, Texas. The National Weather Service reported at least two tornadoes in the area. Ron Jenkins/The Fort Star Telegram/AP
  • Video from CNN Truck trailers tossed by Texas tornado
  • Pictures Twisters rip through Texas | Tornadoes in '12

Doctor sues MGH bosses over control of inventions

Dr. Joseph Grocela is in a legal fight with Mass. General and its corporate parent, Partners HealthCare, over who owns the rights to his medical creations.

Firm finds success with older workers

Nearly half the employees who produce, package, and ship orders at Vita Needle, a maker of stainless steel needles and tubing in Needham, are over 65.
Opinion | Brian McGrory

Tim Cahill’s done, overkill isn’t

AG Martha Coakley stopped the lottery ads in 2010 and voters kicked Cahill to the curb. He has no future in public life. Does he really need the specter of jail?

Researcher says BC broke accord

Boston College and researcher Ed Moloney blamed each other for the international legal struggle over secret interviews with Irish paramilitaries.

Many common procedures
unneeded, say doctors groups

Nine medical specialty groups have released a list of 45 tests and procedures that patients often do not need — even though doctors routinely perform them.

Site steers drivers to parking spots

The website, ParkatmyHouse.com, lists parking spaces available for rent, spot parking in the Fenway or long-term rentals in other crowded neighborhoods.

Making matzo the traditional way

A team of bakers, storytellers, and singers from Model Matzah Bakery made matzo with 37 students at Temple Emeth Nursery School in Chestnut Hill.

News

American woman who became world's oldest doctor dies at 114

Dr. Leila Denmark, the world's oldest practicing physician when she retired at age 103, died Sunday in Athens, Ga., her family members said. She was 114.
